text:
Why has the role of
purpose in organizations

become a frequent
topic of discussion?

Because the world is
changing, redefining
how organizations compete.

Advancements in technology,
entrepreneurial activities,

and financing have
expanded the choices

that people have when choosing
the brands they want to buy

or the companies they
want to work for.

And with corporate value
tied more closely than ever

before to a firm's
social, intellectual,

and human capital, how do
successful businesses respond?

By adopting a growth and
innovation perspective.

Creating new
products and services

or deploying existing
products in new markets
to scale their positive impact.
But how do you get there?

My research identifies
a five action framework
for management.

Find and adopt strategic
environmental, social,
and governance practices.

Create smart ESG goals and
accountability structures.

Lead cultural transformation
with corporate purpose in mind.

Design the
organization for trust

so employees feel they can share
information and collaborate.

And finally, communicate
effectively the outcomes

you are achieving to
investors and the world.
